senses.definition: 1. The top members of a society that control their civilization. 2. Exclusive or top ranking in quality.
examples: Political leaders, corporate CEOs, and top finance managers are all considered part of the Elite.
The best schools, such are Ivy Leagues, are called elite because they are harder to get into and require more connections, qualifications, and money.
The special forces of a military are sometimes called 'elite squads' because they comprise the best fighters and entry is very limited.

senses.definition: pre-evolutionary response to stimulus that gives feelings of sensation to guide behavior without using higher levels of advanced intelligence as a form of instinctual survival and presevation of the species. Example: Maternal instinct operates on pure emotion, without accessing higher human brain function,  to protect young from harm.
